channel.title: Sniff coords out of Runescape client?
channel.description: Is there an easy yet undetectable way to sniff your coords from the runescape client so that you can find them on a private server?

item.title: Sniff coords out of Runescape client?
item.dc:creator: @swordskid61 Swordskid61
item.description:
@swordskid61 wrote:

io9:

[quote author=Swordskid61 link=topic=158015.msg1862268#msg1862268 date=1194056237]…

MoparScape != RuneScape.

P.S. Your sig sucks, l2fakequote[/quote]
l0ol now its real.

Read full topic
item.source: Sniff coords out of Runescape client?

item.title: Sniff coords out of Runescape client?
item.dc:creator: @_cake _cake
item.description:
@_cake wrote:

[quote=“pplsuqbawlz, post:3, topic:110573”]Easy as pie, but it’s not nearly as simplistic as you make it seem…

Try finding static int world_x, world_y; PlayerMe, and Player.x and Player.y

then do this: new Point(me.x << 7 + world_x, me.y << 7 + world_y);

hahaha so this is no help, i cant remember my hooks from the old engine… try using t2 for world x and world y and something like 13### for player x and player y (they’re actually held in the class character)[/quote]
Player is pb in 474 it seems.

Read full topic

item.title: Sniff coords out of Runescape client?
item.dc:creator: @pplsuqbawlz pplsuqbawlz
item.description:
@pplsuqbawlz wrote:

Easy as pie, but it’s not nearly as simplistic as you make it seem…

Try finding static int world_x, world_y; PlayerMe, and Player.x and Player.y

then do this: new Point(me.x << 7 + world_x, me.y << 7 + world_y);

hahaha so this is no help, i cant remember my hooks from the old engine… try using t2 for world x and world y and something like 13### for player x and player y (they’re actually held in the class character)

Read full topic
